page.title: 16Local Correspondant
page.content: Mr. Grocer is the local correspondant for the Dumfries And Galloway Standard since retiring from teaching at Crawfordton House School.He can truly say that he has his finger on the pulse of the village since coming here to live in 1961.He has seen changes since then but mainly in people with births and deaths but some houses have been renovated and some knocked down. He reports on anything which he feels is interesting or important but what he writes is not always what appears in the paper as his editor edits his work according to the available space.He covers school events, obituaries,stories of village life but the most important story,he feels,was when he wrote about the Patterson Evening.James Patterson the famous artist lived in the village and his grandaughter gave a talk and exhibited
